channel.title: Items equipted in the wrong slots
channel.description:
i just recently foudn the codes for alot of customs and tried them all. when i try to equipt the dragon cape (skillcape w/ dragon wings) it equipts into the "weapons" slot, the same thing happens with the dragon kiteshield, the bandos fullhelm (looks like slayer helmet && makes your head look like yu have a metal mowhawk), && the d pl8body which dosn't fit at all. (some of the shirt shows in the front and back)
and the items that are supposed to go into the weapons slot (d claws, bandos scimmy, tri godswords, supreme claws, zuriel's staff, && d pick.
how do i fix this so that the correct items go into the correct slot and that they work properly?

item.title: Items equipted in the wrong slots
item.dc:creator: @MoparScaperDude MoparScaperDude
item.description:
@MoparScaperDude wrote:

There’s more than one item class you need to add them two. I believe it’s Item2 or 3, keep testing each.

Read full topic

item.title: Items equipted in the wrong slots
item.dc:creator: @pl0x15 pl0x15
item.description:
@pl0x15 wrote:

Ok, guy who created this topic, whatever you’re name is. The other guy is right. Junior&Senior title means nothing. The way I see it its just according to post. What if the senior member posted 150 posts saying lolhahahahahaha… hmph? faded. exactly. And way to let you’re whole topic get “off”-topic. Goodluck getting help fussing with the people you’re expecting help from… lol. gf kid. And kid who sed item.class (gf kid) r0fl ur a fail… item classes is the same exact thing he just didnt say item.class or .java dumbass.

item.description:
@attk_mast3r wrote:

same here i have seen 1 senior member so stupid that he couldn’t even figure out how to solve enen the simplest problem.

i am using the dragzscape source and it does have item.java and i imputted the ids in the area according to what they were but liek i said didn’t work they still go to the weapons slot.

Read full topic

item.title: Items equipted in the wrong slots
item.dc:creator: @revengr revengr
item.description:
@revengr wrote:

Once again.
Who’s the one who can’t put the items in the right slots?

You could give some insight as to maybe what source your using so someone can figure out what it uses instead of item.java?
If you don’t know how to put them in the right slot, then how do we know your telling the truth in saying that you put them in the right area?

I’m not calling you an idiot, I’ve just seen cases where senior members weren’t the smartest people in the community.

Read full topic
item.source: Items equipted in the wrong slots

item.title: Items equipted in the wrong slots
item.dc:creator: @attk_mast3r attk mast3r
item.description:
@attk_mast3r wrote:

lol? and yer calling me an idiot? if you could read i said I PUT THE ITEM IDS IN THE CORRECT AREA AND THEY STILL DONT WORK. if your going to post read the post througly and thoughtfully b4 posting. dumbass.

and yes i am implying that. yes anyone can post no amtter how smart they are but lower ranked people tend to not know anything. i saw a senior member that didn’t know anything and i was a member and even knew what that was. but 60% of the lower ranked people aren’t smart with this stuff, like yu.

Read full topic
item.source: Items equipted in the wrong slots

item.title: Items equipted in the wrong slots
item.dc:creator: @revengr revengr
item.description:
@revengr wrote:

[quote=“attk mast3r, post:6, topic:337100”]lol i love how membes think they know more then senior members, and ty 4 helping (:

EDIT: i went into the items.java file and imputted the item ids accordinng to what they are and compiled but it still didn’t work[/quote]
Are you implying that someone who doesn’t have as many posts as a senior member must not be as smart as them?
Anyone can post a lot and still be an idiot.
Apparently he knows more than you if he can get the items in the right fucking slot, and you can’t.

The only static ints you should be adding items to is…
… Amulets, Arrows, Body, Boots, Capes, Gloves, Hats, Legs, Rings, and Shields.

The other areas don’t have an effect on which slot the item goes into.
By default, all items go into the weapon slot when equipped, unless they are added into one of the static ints stated above.

Read full topic
